item.title: Sonic Fans Waited Over A Year For This Crummy Shadow Generations Collector‚Äôs Edition, And They Want Their Money Back
item.content:encoded:
Sonic fans had to wait over a year for their Limited Run Games special edition of Sonic X Shadow Generations. The remaster/excellent pack-in game launched in October of 2024, but with multiple shipment delays, it took 14 months between launch day and the special edition‚Äôs arrival on fans‚Äô doorsteps. Was it worth the wait? Absolutely not.

Several fans are reporting that the package‚Äôs Sonic and Shadow statues are showing up with various defects. Some have scratches, others have misprinted eyes, and one poor soul‚Äôs Shadow arrived with his nose broken off. The special edition cost $249.99 before taxes and shipping, and after a year-long wait, I would also be livid if this is what showed up in the mail.

item.title: Washed-Up Pro Gamer Goes Viral For Griefing In Arc Raiders: ‚ÄòYou Want Optional PvP Go Play WoW‚Äò
item.content:encoded:
The PvP nature of multiplayer extraction shooter Arc Raiders has been contentious since the game‚Äôs launch. There are many who see the ability to kill and be killed by other players are vital for the game‚Äôs tension and enjoyment. There are others who argue it‚Äôs antithetical to the conventions of a game in which a scant, brave few are trying to bring back resources to those living underground. Either way, Arc Raiders players have reached a fascinating and fragile understanding in which most people, most of the time, don‚Äôt kill. So when a retired pro gamer shows up and just starts slaughtering everything, it‚Äôs‚Ä¶well, it‚Äôs just rude!

As IGN reports, Taylor ‚ÄúTHump‚Äù Humphries‚Äîa former pro at games like Apex Legends, Rocket Arena, and H1Z1‚Äîhas decided to spend his spare time taking out as many ‚Äúcasual‚Äù players as he can in Embark‚Äôs breakout hit game. On recent Twitch streams, THump has been broadcasting himself griefing in Arc Raiders for, seemingly, his lone amusement. His most recent stream, a grueling 13 hours long, is primarily the guy killing other players in a game in which most people opt to be peaceful.

Now, let me stress, he‚Äôs doing nothing wrong. Arc Raiders has PvP for a really good reason: it makes it a thousand times more tense to play. Were it only PvE (and honestly, all the wrong parts of me dearly wishes it were), then every interaction with another player would become banal, lacking the terrifying hope for uneasy, fleeting alliances that make it so exciting. Every time a player deliberately kills you, it feels like wanton betrayal, though it‚Äôs clearly well within the rules.

The issue with THump‚Äôs murderstreams is that the entire exercise is the video game equivalent of shitposting. His commentary is incessant irony, with him laughing as he makes other people sad. And, I dunno, I‚Äôm too old and tired to find that shit funny. Somehow this is proving entertaining enough to the streamer that he‚Äôs doing it night after night of late, most recently delighting in lobbing grenades.

Logging in with a full inventory of trigger nades and killing everyone trying to get re-looted after the expedition is a joy. Trigger nades do NOT need a nerf! Livehttps://t.co/hiY3uPb3e7 pic.twitter.com/DuaFRCGlUi

‚Äî THUMP (@THump) December 22, 2025

A few days back, it was this post on X that really riled people up, as THump dropped a clip of his killing a party of four at the very start of a run, when they didn‚Äôt even have any loot to steal. ‚ÄúWe just started, I have nothing,‚Äù said the first person he killed. ‚ÄúWhat scum man,‚Äù they added after the second kill.

I love killing grown men that have jobs and children as they are trying to get 5 million credits for the expedition. Killing all teamers in solos, live now.https://t.co/hiY3uPb3e7 pic.twitter.com/ncHTgNMT1x

‚Äî THUMP (@THump) December 18, 2025

Given THump‚Äôs a troll, his responses to those objecting‚Äîsuch as ‚ÄúI come from a place where PvP is not optional‚Ä¶it‚Äôs a way of life. You want optional PvP go play WoW‚Äú‚Äîare obviously insincere. When one person calls him ‚Äúanother toxic streamer,‚Äù and suggests he‚Äôd have a better time helping other players rather than killing them, he replies, ‚ÄúId rather ruin others time than have fun myself.‚Äù

But, again, he‚Äôs not doing anything wrong. While THump‚Äôs repeated claims of innocence, that he‚Äôs just killing other players ‚Äúin a PvP game,‚Äù are clearly disingenuous, there‚Äôs no arguing that Arc Raiders isn‚Äôt designed to facilitate it. Honestly, as much as seeing someone do this for clout is embarrassing to watch, I take huge solace in knowing that his actions are something that stands out among players. I really rather love that this ostensibly PvP game has somehow engendered a player base that, 90 percent of the time, opts not to kill, even when there‚Äôs personal gain in doing so. In 2025, that feels like a beacon of hope, and a douche like THump exploiting it only highlights how valuable it is.

item.title: The People Yearn For Gay Hockey Romance As Heated Rivalry Ties Top-Rated Episode Of All Time
item.content:encoded:
I have already spread the gospel of Heated Rivalry, the gay hockey romance TV series bestowed upon us by our yaoi-loving neighbors in the north (Canada). But now, weeks later, many more worshippers have heard the word of our gay Lord. 

According to Variety, Heated Rivalry is the most-watched original series ever on Canada‚Äôs Bell Media Crave streaming service. In the United States, it‚Äôs the top-rated non-animated series HBO Max has acquired since its launch in 2020, and amongst the top five of all scripted debuts on the streaming service this year. 

The breakout TV series is spreading like flash frost across the nation. There‚Äôs an entire TikTok cottage industry dedicated to the show (I bought my sister a shirt through it). The gay bar I occasionally work at won‚Äôt stop playing ‚ÄúAll The Things She Said‚Äù over the speakers. They‚Äôre playing scenes on the Jumbotron at hockey games, they‚Äôre doing flirty Teen Vogue videos, they‚Äôve got packed WeHo sports bars screaming over the most recent episode. 

That episode, titled ‚ÄúI‚Äôll Believe in Anything,‚Äù is currently rated as the second-best episode of television ever by IMDB users, topped (teehee) only by Breaking Bad‚Äôs ‚ÄúOzymandias.‚Äù Both episodes have a perfect 10-star score, but Heated Rivalry‚Äòs up there with just 31,000 votes compared to Breaking Bad‚Äòs 273,000.

Consent king Ilya pic.twitter.com/Id5o8egZJ3

‚Äî Empty Netters (@EmptyNettersPod) December 21, 2025

Though both showrunner Jacob Tierney (Letterkenny, Shoresy) and newcomer stars Connor Storrie and Hudson Williams are shocked by Heated Rivalry becoming one of the year‚Äôs biggest shows, there is something especially stunning about how the world of hockey has welcomed it. There are straight dudes with hockey podcasts watching a gay show with earnestness and excitement‚Äînot judgment. 

The NHL, a league infamous for its players hurling homophobic slurs and refusing to take part in Pride nights, is embracing the newfound attention the sport has gotten thanks to Heated Rivalry (hockey has struggled to gain a consistent viewership foothold in the States). ‚ÄúThere are so many ways to get hooked on hockey and, in the NHL‚Äôs 108-year history, this might be the most unique driver for creating new fans. See you all at the rink,‚Äù a league spokesperson told The Hollywood Reporter. 

If you have a young woman or a gay man in your family, expect to hear about this show during Christmas if you haven‚Äôt already. Especially because the season finale of Heated Rivalry airs on HBO Max at 12 a.m. ET on December 26.

Yesterday, it was confirmed that Vince Zampella, the head of Respawn also known for his work as a lead developer on Call of Duty and Battlefield, was killed in a car accident on Sunday, December 21. Zampella had a storied career, co-founding Infinity Ward in 2002, which would go on to spend the next two decades creating Call of Duty games. After a messy breakup with Activision, he went on to found Titanfall developer Respawn Entertainment and was eventually made the lead of the Battlefield franchise in 2021.

We are heartbroken by the loss of Vince Zampella, a creative leader whose work shaped generations of players and helped define what modern shooters and action games could be.

item.title: Shokz OpenRun Pro 2 Price Drop Makes It a Budget Bone Conduction Headphone, Gear Up for Your 2026 Fitness Goals
item.content:encoded:
As we approach the new year, you might find yourself thinking a lot about your goals for 2026. Lots of folks go into January big ambitions to get in shape and keep to a regular fitness routine, but the reality many also drop any health changes they‚Äôre trying to make by February. It‚Äôs a motivation and discipline issue, but you can help yourself look forward to your time in the gym or time running outdoors with the right tools. I‚Äôm talking about a good pair of headphones. I like to use my time running to catch up on podcasts that I otherwise, wouldn‚Äôt get a chance during the day to listen to. My Shokz OpenRun Pro headphones are my perfect companion for this. Right now, their replacement model are on sale for 22% off on Amazon, bringing the price down from $180 to just $140, saving you $40.

See at Amazon

Bone Conduction Technology

These headphones stand out from regular earbuds because they don‚Äôt go in your ears. Instead, they rest around your ears and use bone conduction to deliver sound. This means that sound vibrations are transmitted through your cheekbones, not through your ear canals. It‚Äôs a concept many of us might recall from those quirky lollipop toys in the 90s that played music when you bit into them, though the Shokz headphones offer a much higher-quality listening experience.

The main benefit of this design is that it keeps your ears open to the sounds around you, which can be crucial, especially when running outdoors. Being aware of your environment is a safety issue. Whether it‚Äôs listening for approaching cars or simply staying aware of other runners or pedestrians, bone conduction allows you to enjoy your music or podcasts without losing situational awareness.

Comfort and Fit

The Shokz OpenRun Pro 2 headphones have a design that comfortably sits on your ears, resembling a pair of sunglasses worn backward. They feature a lightweight, flexible titanium frame that wraps around your head, ensuring the headphones stay securely in place even during intense workouts. This design is especially great if you‚Äôve ever been worried about earbuds falling out while running or exercising.

When it comes to battery performance, the Shokz OpenRun Pro 2 doesn‚Äôt disappoint. You can enjoy up to 12 hours of continuous listening on a single charge. And if you need a quick recharge, just five minutes of charging provides you with around 1.5 hours of playtime, which is incredibly convenient when you‚Äôre about to head out for a run and realize you forgot to charge them beforehand.

Shokz also offers a mini version of the OpenRun Pro 2 for those who need a more snug fit. The mini model has a shorter connecting band, making it more suitable for smaller heads. The standard version measures 20.7 cm across, while the mini is 18.6 cm. If you‚Äôre unsure which model would be the best fit, Shokz provides guidance on their website to help you decide.

Both the standard and mini versions are currently available at the same discount, and the colors you can choose from include black, silver, orange, and blue. Each of them are on sale for the same discount so you can choose based on your personal preference, and not which will save you more money.

item.title: Maybe The Weirdest Thing Anyone‚Äôs Ever Said In A Video Game Lawsuit
item.content:encoded:
Lil Wayne makes an unexpected appearance in a very unusual legal fight. Call of Duty is coming to Switch as soon as a few months from now. And one of Ubisoft‚Äôs Canadian studios just unionized. It‚Äôs the latest edition of Morning Checkpoint, Kotaku‚Äòs daily roundup of gaming news and culture. I‚Äôm finalizing my personal game of the year list and I think I‚Äôve almost nailed it. What games do you wish more people had paid attention to this year?

‚ÄúOkay, you‚Äôre a goon, but what‚Äôs a goon to a Goblin?? Nothin‚Äô. Nothin‚Äô. You ain‚Äôt scaring nothing.‚Äù

That‚Äôs how attorney Ray Kim described Aspyr, the company behind a Switch port of Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic II that ended up at the center of a very bizarre lawsuit, Game File reports. Those are lyrics from Lil Wayne on the track ‚ÄúWe Be Steady Mobbin.‚Äù Aspyr were the ‚Äúgoons,‚Äù per the legal filing in an actual court of law, while the players suing over missing DLC were ‚Äúthe goblins, and they will not be deterred.‚Äù The group reached a settlement earlier this month but the long, messy paper trail revealed plenty of other interesting nuggets, including the existence of an apparent KOTOR 2 remake.

Divinity‚Äòs director suggests you might not want to bother with the old games

‚ÄúIf you play [the two Divinity: Original Sin games], you will see things in [the upcoming] Divinity that reference those two,‚Äù Swen Vincke told GamesRadar. ‚ÄúIf you played the first Divinity, you will see it referenced properly inside of this Divinity. Ego Draconis, same story, or The Dragon Knight Saga, all of it is being referenced, but it‚Äôs just part of the history of what happened in this world, and it helped shape the world to the point where it is now.‚Äù

But if you just want a taste of the lore and came to Larian through the cinematic feel of Baldur‚Äôs Gate 3, just play Original Sin 2. ‚ÄúIf you played because you really enjoy tactical combat or co-op multiplayer or really having lots of freedom, you should definitely play Original Sin 2, because that‚Äôs a game that was a blueprint for BG3,‚Äù he said.

Call of Duty will reportedly come to Switch soon

Years after signing an agreement to bring the franchise back to Nintendo‚Äôs platforms, the shooter is still MIA. ‚ÄúThe first CoD Switch version is nearly done,‚Äù claims Windows Central‚Äòs Jez Corden. He said it‚Äôs currently scheduled for a 2026 release, though it‚Äôs not entirely clear which form the game will take: a port of an existing sequel or a completely different experience. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre committed to getting the franchise on Switch,‚Äù a spokesperson for Activision confirmed earlier this year.

We almost got Grand Theft Auto: Tokyo

Ex-Rockstar North tech director Obbe Vermei, who worked on the franchise‚Äôs PS2-era games, said the studio had once looked at setting the open-world formula in cities all across the world, Assassin‚Äôs Creed-style. An entry based in Japan was the closest to getting off the ground. ‚ÄúWe had ideas about GTA games in Rio de Janeiro, Moscow and Istanbul,‚Äù he told Games Hub in a recent interview. ‚ÄúTokyo almost actually happened. Another studio in Japan were going to do it, take our code and do GTA: Tokyo. But then that didn‚Äôt happen in the end.‚Äù

He continued, ‚ÄúPeople love having these wild ideas but then when you‚Äôve got billions of dollars riding on it, it‚Äôs too easy to go ‚Äòlet‚Äôs do what we know again,‚Äô and also America is basically the epicenter of Western culture, so everybody knows the cities, even people who haven‚Äôt been there. They have a mental image of the cities.‚Äù

A Ubisoft studio in North America just unionized for the first time

Ubisoft Halifax is located in Nova Scotia and works on mobile projects, including Rainbow Six Siege Mobile. The group announced its plan to unionize earlier this year and had a majority vote ratified last week after Ubisoft dropped its initial challenges. ‚ÄúIt has started a conversation,‚Äù programmer Jon Huffman told CTV News. ‚ÄúColleagues have reached out to say it‚Äôs a huge surprise. Whether or not they choose to follow, that‚Äôs up to them. We‚Äôve shown the way forward, hopefully.‚Äù

Bloober Team‚Äôs next project name-checks some of the best horror games

‚ÄúYou have no idea how hard it is for me not to reveal what Project M truly is‚Äîbut for now, it‚Äôs still too early to talk about it. We‚Äôre confident that we‚Äôll be able to share the first details very soon,‚Äù CEO Piotr Babieno told Nintendo Insider. ‚ÄúWhat I can say is this: fans of Resident Evil, Silent Hill, Limbo, and Eternal Darkness will immediately feel at home. That said, Project M introduces a bold twist‚Äîone that no horror game has ever explored before. This is a vision that could only exist on Nintendo hardware.‚Äù

  • More games like Mafia: The Old Country, please
  • Cyberpunk 2077‚Äòs super Switch 2 discount was too good to be true
